abstract: The market for initial public offerings of Internet startups has been weak in the past few years. So for venture investors and Silicon Valley entrepreneurs seeking a way to cash out, a sale to Google, Yahoo and a handful of other Web giants has become the brass ring. So what does Google, which has about $11 billion in cash and lots of high-priced stock to use as currency, look for in an acquisition target? According to its chief dealmaker, Google likes ideas that are “really crazy.”
lead_paragraph: The market for initial public offerings of Internet startups has been weak in the past few years. So for venture investors and Silicon Valley entrepreneurs seeking a way to cash out, a sale to Google, Yahoo and a handful of other Web giants has become the brass ring. So what does Google, which has about $11 billion in cash and lots of high-priced stock to use as currency, look for in an acquisition target? According to its chief dealmaker, Google likes ideas that are “really crazy.”
